Water Gem.name: Water Gem
Water Gem.effect: Increases the power of a Water-type move only once.

Water Memory.name: Water Memory
Water Memory.effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Water type.

Waterium Z.name: Waterium Z
Waterium Z.effect: Allows the use of Hydro Vortex, the Water type Z-Move.

Watmel Berry.name: Watmel Berry
Watmel Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Wave Incense.name: Wave Incense
Wave Incense.effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves. Breeding Mantine produces Mantyke when held.

Weakness Policy.name: Weakness Policy
Weakness Policy.effect: Sharply raises Attack and Special Attack if hit by a super-effective move.

Wepear Berry.name: Wepear Berry
Wepear Berry.effect: A Berry which is very rare in the Unova region. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Whipped Dream.name: Whipped Dream
Whipped Dream.effect: Evolves Swirlix when traded holding the item.

White Apricorn.name: White Apricorn
White Apricorn.effect: A white Apricorn. It doesn't smell like anything.

White Flute.name: White Flute
White Flute.effect: A toy flute made from white glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

White Herb.name: White Herb
White Herb.effect: An item to be held by a POKéMON. It restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

Wiki Berry.name: Wiki Berry
Wiki Berry.effect: Restores HP if it's low, but may cause confusion.

Wise Glasses.name: Wise Glasses
Wise Glasses.effect: Increases the power of Special-category moves.

Wishing Piece.name: Wishing Piece
Wishing Piece.effect: Activates a Pokémon Den for a Max Raid Battle.

X Accuracy.name: X Accuracy
X Accuracy.effect: Raises Accuracy of a Pokémon in battle.

X Accuracy 2.name: X Accuracy 2
X Accuracy 2.effect: Sharply raises Accuracy of a Pokémon in battle.

X Accuracy 3.name: X Accuracy 3
X Accuracy 3.effect: Drastically raises Accuracy of a Pokémon in battle.

X Accuracy 6.name: X Accuracy 6
X Accuracy 6.effect: Immensely raises Accuracy of a Pokémon in battle.

X Attack.name: X Attack
X Attack.effect: Raises Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Attack 2.name: X Attack 2
X Attack 2.effect: Sharply raises Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Attack 3.name: X Attack 3
X Attack 3.effect: Drastically raises Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Attack 6.name: X Attack 6
X Attack 6.effect: Immensely raises Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Defense.name: X Defense
X Defense.effect: Raises Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Defense 2.effect: Sharply raises Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Defense 3.name: X Defense 3
X Defense 3.effect: Drastically raises Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Defense 6.name: X Defense 6
X Defense 6.effect: Immensely raises Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Atk.name: X Sp. Atk
X Sp. Atk.effect: Raises Special Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Atk 2.name: X Sp. Atk 2
X Sp. Atk 2.effect: Sharply raises Special Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Atk 3.name: X Sp. Atk 3
X Sp. Atk 3.effect: Drastically raises Special Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Atk 6.name: X Sp. Atk 6
X Sp. Atk 6.effect: Immensely raises Special Attack of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Def.name: X Sp. Def
X Sp. Def.effect: Raises Special Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Def 2.name: X Sp. Def 2
X Sp. Def 2.effect: Sharply raises Special Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Def 3.name: X Sp. Def 3
X Sp. Def 3.effect: Drastically raises Special Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Sp. Def 6.name: X Sp. Def 6
X Sp. Def 6.effect: Immensely raises Special Defense of a Pokémon in battle.

X Speed.name: X Speed
X Speed.effect: Raises Speed of a Pokémon in battle.

X Speed 2.name: X Speed 2
X Speed 2.effect: Sharply raises Speed of a Pokémon in battle.

X Speed 3.name: X Speed 3
X Speed 3.effect: Drastically raises Speed of a Pokémon in battle.

X Speed 6.name: X Speed 6
X Speed 6.effect: Immensely raises Speed of a Pokémon in battle.

Yache Berry.name: Yache Berry
Yache Berry.effect: Weakens a supereffective Ice-type attack against the holding Pokémon.

Yellow Apricorn.name: Yellow Apricorn
Yellow Apricorn.effect: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

Yellow Flute.name: Yellow Flute
Yellow Flute.effect: A toy flute made from yellow glass. A maniac will buy it for a high price.

Yellow Nectar.name: Yellow Nectar
Yellow Nectar.effect: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

Yellow Scarf.name: Yellow Scarf
Yellow Scarf.effect: Raises holder's Tough aspect in a Contest.

Yellow Shard.name: Yellow Shard
Yellow Shard.effect: A small yellow shard. It appears to be from some sort of implement made long ago.

Zap Plate.name: Zap Plate
Zap Plate.effect: Increases power of Electric-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Electric.

Zoom Lens.name: Zoom Lens
Zoom Lens.effect: Raises a move's accuracy if the holder moves after its target.

Acro Bike.name: Acro Bike
Acro Bike.effect: A folding bicycle that is capable of stunts like jumps and wheelies.

Adventure Rules.name: Adventure Rules
Adventure Rules.effect: This book contains all the points a new Trainer needs to know on a journey. It was handmade by a kind friend.

Amaze Mulch.name: Amaze Mulch
Amaze Mulch.effect: Mulch to be used in a Berry field. An amazing Mulch with the effects of Rich, Surprise, and Boost Mulch.

Apricorn Box.name: Apricorn Box
Apricorn Box.effect: A handy box where you can store up to 99 Apricorns of each kind.

Aqua Suit.name: Aqua Suit
Aqua Suit.effect: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Aqua. It can withstand any impact.

AuroraTicket.name: AuroraTicket
AuroraTicket.effect: A ticket required to board the ship to BIRTH ISLAND. It glows beautifully.

Autograph.name: Autograph
Autograph.effect: The autograph you got from the Vermilion City Gym Leader, Lt. Surge. He wrote, "Good luck!"

Azure Flute.name: Azure Flute
Azure Flute.effect: A flute that puts out echoing sounds that do not seem to be of this world. It is unknown who made it.

Band Autograph.name: Band Autograph
Band Autograph.effect: It’s signed by all members of the Galar region’s most charismatic band, the Maximizers.

Basement Key.name: Basement Key
Basement Key.effect: A key that opens a door in the Goldenrod Tunnel.

Berry Pots.name: Berry Pots
Berry Pots.effect: Handy containers for cultivating Berry wherever you go.

Berry Pouch.name: Berry Pouch
Berry Pouch.effect: A pouch for carrying BERRIES. It is attached to the BAG's compartment for important items.

Bike.name: Bike
Bike.effect: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get around much faster than with Running Shoes.

Bike Voucher.name: Bike Voucher
Bike Voucher.effect: Take this voucher to the BIKE SHOP in CERULEAN CITY and exchange it for a bicycle.

Black Mane Hair.name: Black Mane Hair
Black Mane Hair.effect: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very smooth to the touch.

Blue Card.name: Blue Card
Blue Card.effect: A card to save points for the Buena's Password show.

Blue Orb.name: Blue Orb
Blue Orb.effect: A shiny blue orb that is said to have a legend and has a deep connection with the Hoenn region.

Blue Petal.name: Blue Petal
Blue Petal.effect: Petal received from Lana during Mina's trial.

Boost Mulch.name: Boost Mulch
Boost Mulch.effect: Mulch to be used in a Berry field. It increases the Berry harvest that can be grown by diligent watering.

Card Key.name: Card Key
Card Key.effect: A card key that opens a shutter in the Radio Tower.

Catching Charm.name: Catching Charm
Catching Charm.effect: Holding it is said to increase the chance of getting a critical catch. Curiously, the charm doesn’t shake much.

Clear Bell.name: Clear Bell
Clear Bell.effect: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing.

Coin Case.name: Coin Case
Coin Case.effect: A case for holding Coins obtained at the Game Corner. It holds up to 50,000 Coins.

Colress Machine.name: Colress Machine
Colress Machine.effect: A special device that wrings out the potential of Pokémon. It is an imperfect prototype.

Contest Costume.name: Contest Costume
Contest Costume.effect: A very cool suit to be worn during the Contest Spectacular.

Contest Pass.name: Contest Pass
Contest Pass.effect: The pass required for entering POKéMON CONTESTS. It has a drawing of an award ribbon on it.

Coupon 1.name: Coupon 1
Coupon 1.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch (Pokétch for short). Three coupons are needed.

Coupon 2.name: Coupon 2
Coupon 2.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch (Pokétch for short). Three coupons are needed.

Coupon 3.name: Coupon 3
Coupon 3.effect: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch (Pokétch for short). Three coupons are needed.

Crown Pass.name: Crown Pass
Crown Pass.effect: A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail staff at Wedgehurst Station.

Dark Stone.name: Dark Stone
Dark Stone.effect: Zekrom's body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

Data Card 01.name: Data Card 01
Data Card 01.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many victories you've had.

Data Card 02.name: Data Card 02
Data Card 02.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many losses you've had.

Data Card 03.name: Data Card 03
Data Card 03.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon have dashed.

Data Card 04.name: Data Card 04
Data Card 04.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon have jumped.

Data Card 05.name: Data Card 05
Data Card 05.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won the Hurdle Dash.

Data Card 06.name: Data Card 06
Data Card 06.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won the Relay Run.

Data Card 07.name: Data Card 07
Data Card 07.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Pennant Capture.

Data Card 08.name: Data Card 08
Data Card 08.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Block Smash.

Data Card 09.name: Data Card 09
Data Card 09.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Disc Catch.

Data Card 10.name: Data Card 10
Data Card 10.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Snow Throw.

Data Card 11.name: Data Card 11
Data Card 11.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many points your Pokémon scored.

Data Card 12.name: Data Card 12
Data Card 12.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon have failed.

Data Card 13.name: Data Card 13
Data Card 13.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon impeded themselves.

Data Card 14.name: Data Card 14
Data Card 14.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon have tackled.

Data Card 15.name: Data Card 15
Data Card 15.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon have fallen down.

Data Card 16.name: Data Card 16
Data Card 16.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Ring Drop.

Data Card 17.name: Data Card 17
Data Card 17.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Lamp Jump.

Data Card 18.name: Data Card 18
Data Card 18.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Circle Push.

Data Card 19.name: Data Card 19
Data Card 19.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many Link Pokéathlon wins you've had.

Data Card 20.name: Data Card 20
Data Card 20.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many Link Pokéathlon losses you've had.

Data Card 21.name: Data Card 21
Data Card 21.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won an event.

Data Card 22.name: Data Card 22
Data Card 22.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've lost an event.

Data Card 23.name: Data Card 23
Data Card 23.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've switched Pokémon.

Data Card 24.name: Data Card 24
Data Card 24.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've won Goal Roll.

Data Card 25.name: Data Card 25
Data Card 25.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times your Pokémon won individual prizes.

Data Card 26.name: Data Card 26
Data Card 26.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how many times you've instructed your Pokémon.

Data Card 27.name: Data Card 27
Data Card 27.effect: It holds Pokéathlon records. It's a card that shows how much time you've spent in the Pokéathlon.

Devon Parts.name: Devon Parts
Devon Parts.effect: A case that contains mechanical parts of some sort made by the Devon Corporation.

Devon Scope.name: Devon Scope
Devon Scope.effect: A scope that signals the presence of any unseeable POKéMON. It is made by the DEVON CORP.

Devon Scuba Gear.name: Devon Scuba Gear
Devon Scuba Gear.effect: A device made by Devon Corporation that provides oxygen to users during the use of Dive.

Dowsing Machine.name: Dowsing Machine
Dowsing Machine.effect: Searches for hidden items on the ground.

Dragon Skull.name: Dragon Skull
Dragon Skull.effect: A skull of a Pokémon which was said to have braved the angry waters to fly around the world.

Enigma Stone.name: Enigma Stone
Enigma Stone.effect: A crystal ball that was excavated from the ground. A very beautiful stone that is covered with bits of rock and earth.

Enigmatic Card.name: Enigmatic Card
Enigmatic Card.effect: A mysterious card. Written on it is a request for you to go to a guest room in an Akala motel on Route 8.

Eon Flute.name: Eon Flute
Eon Flute.effect: A flute that can be used to summon Latios or Latias no matter where you are.

Eon Ticket.name: Eon Ticket
Eon Ticket.effect: The ticket required for sailing on a ferry to a distant southern island. It features a drawing of an island.

Explorer Kit.name: Explorer Kit
Explorer Kit.effect: A bag filled with convenient tools for exploring. It provides access to the Underground.

Fame Checker.name: Fame Checker
Fame Checker.effect: A device that enables you to recall what you've heard and seen about famous people.

Fashion Case.name: Fashion Case
Fashion Case.effect: A lovely case to store colorful Props for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

Fishing Rod.name: Fishing Rod
Fishing Rod.effect: A Fishing Rod made by Captain Lana. Cast a line over piles of underwater rocks to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Forage Bag.name: Forage Bag
Forage Bag.effect: A bag to carry ingredients gathered during Mallow's trial in the jungle.

Galactic Key.name: Galactic Key
Galactic Key.effect: A card key for disengaging security systems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it can result in punishment, apparently.

GB Sounds.name: GB Sounds
GB Sounds.effect: A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic songs. It's operated with a single switch.

Go-Goggles.name: Go-Goggles
Go-Goggles.effect: A pair of protective goggles. They enable a TRAINER to travel through even desert sandstorms.

Gold Teeth.name: Gold Teeth
Gold Teeth.effect: A set of false teeth lost by the SAFARI ZONE'S WARDEN. It makes his smile sparkle.

Good Rod.name: Good Rod
Good Rod.effect: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Gracidea.name: Gracidea
Gracidea.effect: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets to convey gratitude on special occasions like birthdays.

Gram 1.name: Gram 1
Gram 1.effect: An important letter which Wingull delivers.

Gram 2.name: Gram 2
Gram 2.effect: An important letter which Wingull delivers.

Gram 3.name: Gram 3
Gram 3.effect: An important letter which Wingull delivers.

Green Petal.name: Green Petal
Green Petal.effect: Petal received from Mallow during Mina's trial.

Holo Caster.name: Holo Caster
Holo Caster.effect: A device that allows users to receive and view hologram clips at any time. It is also used to chat with others.

Ilima's Normalium Z.name: Ilima's Normalium Z
Ilima's Normalium Z.effect: The Normalium Z you were entrusted with by Ilima.

Jade Orb.name: Jade Orb
Jade Orb.effect: A shiny green orb that is said to have a legend and has a deep connection with the Hoenn region.

Journal.name: Journal
Journal.effect: A notebook that keeps a day-to-day record of your adventure so far.

Key Stone.name: Key Stone
Key Stone.effect: A stone filled with an unexplained power. It makes Pokémon that battle with a Mega Stone Mega Evolve.

Key to Room 1.name: Key to Room 1
Key to Room 1.effect: Unlocks Room 1 in Abandoned Ship/Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 2.name: Key to Room 2
Key to Room 2.effect: Unlocks Room 2 in Abandoned Ship/Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 4.name: Key to Room 4
Key to Room 4.effect: Unlocks Room 4 in Abandoned Ship/Sea Mauville.

Key to Room 6.name: Key to Room 6
Key to Room 6.effect: Unlocks Room 6 in Abandoned Ship/Sea Mauville.

Left Poké Ball.name: Left Poké Ball
Left Poké Ball.effect: A Poké Ball with a Pokémon that lost its Trainer inside.

Legendary Clue?.name: Legendary Clue?
Legendary Clue?.effect: A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped. There’s a photo attached to it showing a shining hole opening above the Max Lair.

Legendary Clue 1.name: Legendary Clue 1
Legendary Clue 1.effect: A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It’s written by Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.

Legendary Clue 2.name: Legendary Clue 2
Legendary Clue 2.effect: A clue about the legend of giants. It’s written by Peony and has unique drawings.

Legendary Clue 3.name: Legendary Clue 3
Legendary Clue 3.effect: A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It’s written by Peony and has a unique drawing.

Lens Case.name: Lens Case
Lens Case.effect: A rather chic-looking case for carrying contact lenses.

Letter.name: Letter
Letter.effect: An extremely important letter to STEVEN from the PRESIDENT of the DEVON CORPORATION.

Liberty Pass.name: Liberty Pass
Liberty Pass.effect: A special pass to go to Liberty Garden. Board the ship in Castelia City.

Lift Key.name: Lift Key
Lift Key.effect: A key that operates the elevator in TEAM ROCKET's HIDEOUT. It bears the TEAM ROCKET logo.

Light Stone.name: Light Stone
Light Stone.effect: Reshiram's body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

Lock Capsule.name: Lock Capsule
Lock Capsule.effect: A sturdy Capsule that can only be opened with a special key.

Loot Sack.name: Loot Sack
Loot Sack.effect: A sturdy, spacious bag that is used to carry loot obtained in the coal mine.

Lost Item.name: Lost Item
Lost Item.effect: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by the Copycat.

Lunar Wing.name: Lunar Wing
Lunar Wing.effect: A feather that glows like the moon. It is said to possess the power to dispel nightmares.

Mach Bike.name: Mach Bike
Mach Bike.effect: A folding bicycle that is at least twice as fast as walking.

Machine Part.name: Machine Part
Machine Part.effect: An important machine part for the Power Plant that was stolen.

Magma Emblem.name: Magma Emblem
Magma Emblem.effect: A medal-like item in the same shape as TEAM MAGMA's mark.

Magma Stone.name: Magma Stone
Magma Stone.effect: A stone formed when boulders melted in intensely hot magma, then hardened. Magma remains sealed inside.

Magma Suit.name: Magma Suit
Magma Suit.effect: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Magma. It can withstand any impact.

Makeup Bag.name: Makeup Bag
Makeup Bag.effect: A rather chic-looking case for carrying lipsticks.

Medal Box.name: Medal Box
Medal Box.effect: A box-shaped machine that stores Medals and Medal information.

Mega Bracelet.name: Mega Bracelet
Mega Bracelet.effect: This cuff contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

Mega Ring.name: Mega Ring
Mega Ring.effect: Enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

Member Card.name: Member Card
Member Card.effect: A card needed for entering the inn in Canalave City. Oddly, the last date marked on it was 50 years ago.

Meteorite.name: Meteorite
Meteorite.effect: A meteorite that fell from space onto MT. MOON long ago. It is very lumpy and hard.

Meteorite Shard.name: Meteorite Shard
Meteorite Shard.effect: One of the fragments of a Meteorite from Granite Cave. It's faintly warm to the touch.

Moon Flute.name: Moon Flute
Moon Flute.effect: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the moon.

Mystery Egg.name: Mystery Egg
Mystery Egg.effect: A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon. What's in the Egg is unknown.

MysticTicket.name: MysticTicket
MysticTicket.effect: A ticket required to board the ship to NAVEL ROCK. It glows with a mystic light.

N-Lunarizer.name: N-Lunarizer
N-Lunarizer.effect: A machine to fuse/separate Necrozma and Lunala.

N-Solarizer.name: N-Solarizer
N-Solarizer.effect: A machine to fuse/separate Necrozma and Solgaleo.

Oak's Letter.name: Oak's Letter
Oak's Letter.effect: A letter from Prof. Oak. Written in it is a request for you to go to Rt. 224.

Oak's Parcel.name: Oak's Parcel
Oak's Parcel.effect: A parcel to be delivered to PROF. OAK from VIRIDIAN CITY's POKéMON MART.

Old Charm.name: Old Charm
Old Charm.effect: An ancient good-luck charm made of Pokémon bones to be taken to the elder of Celestic Town.

Old Letter.name: Old Letter
Old Letter.effect: A letter entrusted to you by a girl, to be delivered to a boy. Strangely, it looks old to you.

Old Rod.name: Old Rod
Old Rod.effect: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Old Sea Map.name: Old Sea Map
Old Sea Map.effect: A faded sea chart that shows the way to a certain island.

Old Verse.name: Old Verse
Old Verse.effect: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed around the Hisui region.

Orange Petal.name: Orange Petal
Orange Petal.effect: Petal received from Ilima during Mina's trial.

Pair of Tickets.name: Pair of Tickets
Pair of Tickets.effect: Tickets for two to the astronomical show being held at the Mossdeep Space Center.

Pal Pad.name: Pal Pad
Pal Pad.effect: A convenient notepad that is used for registering your friends, Friend Codes, and keeping a record of game play.

Parcel.name: Parcel
Parcel.effect: A parcel entrusted in your care. You are supposed to deliver it to your childhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.effect: A ticket required for riding the Magnet Train. It allows you to ride whenever and however much you'd like.

Photo Album.name: Photo Album
Photo Album.effect: A nice photo album for storing all the photos taken along your adventure.

Pink Petal.name: Pink Petal
Pink Petal.effect: Petal received from Mina during Mina's trial.

Poffin Case.name: Poffin Case
Poffin Case.effect: A case for storing Poffin cooked from Berry.

Point Card.name: Point Card
Point Card.effect: A card that lists the Battle Points you have earned.

Poké Flute.name: Poké Flute
Poké Flute.effect: A flute that is said to instantly awaken any POKéMON. It has a lovely tone.

Poké Radar.name: Poké Radar
Poké Radar.effect: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

Pokéblock Case.name: Pokéblock Case
Pokéblock Case.effect: A case for holding POKéBLOCKS made with a BERRY BLENDER. It releases one POKéBLOCK when shaken.

Pokéblock Kit.name: Pokéblock Kit
Pokéblock Kit.effect: A set containing a Berry Blender for making Pokéblocks and a Pokéblock Case for storing Pokéblocks.

Powder Jar.name: Powder Jar
Powder Jar.effect: A jar for storing BERRY POWDER made using a BERRY CRUSHER.

Professor's Mask.name: Professor's Mask
Professor's Mask.effect: The mask that belongs to The Masked Royal. This pro wrestler apparently sews his mask on a machine himself.

Prop Case.name: Prop Case
Prop Case.effect: A lovely case to store colorful Props for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

Purple Petal.name: Purple Petal
Purple Petal.effect: Petal received from Nanu during Mina's trial.

Radiant Petal.name: Radiant Petal
Radiant Petal.effect: A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests gave you. It radiates faint light.

Rainbow Flower.name: Rainbow Flower
Rainbow Flower.effect: Flower made of the petals received from captains.

Rainbow Pass.name: Rainbow Pass
Rainbow Pass.effect: A pass for ferries between VERMILION and the SEVII ISLANDS. It features a drawing of a rainbow.

Rainbow Wing.name: Rainbow Wing
Rainbow Wing.effect: A mystical rainbow feather that sparkles.

Red Chain.name: Red Chain
Red Chain.effect: A mythical chain that is said to image the legendary Pokémon that created the Sinnoh region.

Red Orb.name: Red Orb
Red Orb.effect: A shiny red orb that is said to have a legend and has a deep connection with the Hoenn region.

Red Petal.name: Red Petal
Red Petal.effect: Petal received from Kiawe during Mina's trial.

Red Scale.name: Red Scale
Red Scale.effect: A scale from the red GYARADOS. It glows red like a flame.

Reins of Unity.name: Reins of Unity
Reins of Unity.effect: Cords that shine when you hold them up to the light. The people of old times presented these to the King of Bountiful Harvests to express their gratitude.

Rich Mulch.name: Rich Mulch
Rich Mulch.effect: Mulch to be used in a Berry field. It increases the Berry harvest without the need for particularly diligent care.

Ride Pager.name: Ride Pager
Ride Pager.effect: By entering certain numbers on this pager, you can summon Ride Pokémon in an instant.

Rotom Bike.name: Rotom Bike
Rotom Bike.effect: This bike can be combined with the Pokémon Rotom to not only do a turbo boost but also run on the water.

Rotom Catalog.name: Rotom Catalog
Rotom Catalog.effect: A catalog of devices that Rotom like. Use the catalog to have Rotom hop in and out of the various devices listed within.

Ruby.name: Ruby
Ruby.effect: An exquisitely beautiful gem that has a red glow. It symbolizes passion.

Rule Book.name: Rule Book
Rule Book.effect: It lists the rules for holding battles. For imageed battles, you may choose which set of rules you wish to use.

Rusted Shield.name: Rusted Shield
Rusted Shield.effect: It is said that a hero used this shield to halt a terrible disaster in ancient times. But it’s grown rusty and worn.

Rusted Sword.name: Rusted Sword
Rusted Sword.effect: It is said that a hero used this sword to halt a terrible disaster in ancient times. But it’s grown rusty and worn.

Sapphire.name: Sapphire
Sapphire.effect: An exquisitely beautiful gem that has a blue glow. It symbolizes honesty.

Scanner.name: Scanner
Scanner.effect: A device used to search for life-forms in water. It looks too difficult to use.

Seal Bag.name: Seal Bag
Seal Bag.effect: A tiny bag that can hold ten Seals for decorating Poké Balls.

Seal Case.name: Seal Case
Seal Case.effect: A case for storing Seals that can be applied to the capsule cases of Poké Balls.

Secret Key.name: Secret Key
Secret Key.effect: A high-tech key that has to be used at a specific location. It emits a special electric signal to open a door.

Secret Potion.name: Secret Potion
Secret Potion.effect: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the pharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully heals a Pokémon of any ailment.

Silph Scope.name: Silph Scope
Silph Scope.effect: A scope that makes unseeable POKéMON visible. It is made by SILPH CO.

Silver Wing.name: Silver Wing
Silver Wing.effect: A strange, silvery feather that sparkles.

Slowpoke Tail.name: Slowpoke Tail
Slowpoke Tail.effect: A very tasty tail of something. It sells for a high price.

Sonia's Book.name: Sonia's Book
Sonia's Book.effect: Professor Sonia’s published writings. Her new discoveries about the Galar region’s legends are recorded in this enjoyable read.

Soot Sack.name: Soot Sack
Soot Sack.effect: A sack used to collect volcanic ash automatically during walks over deep ash.

Sparkling Stone.name: Sparkling Stone
Sparkling Stone.effect: A stone entrusted by a Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity in the Alola region. There is said to be some secret in how it sparkles.

Sprayduck.name: Sprayduck
Sprayduck.effect: A watering can shaped like a PSYDUCK. It helps promote healthy growth of Berry planted in soft soil.

Squirt Bottle.name: Squirt Bottle
Squirt Bottle.effect: A bottle used for watering plants in the Berry Pots.

S.S. Ticket.name: S.S. Ticket
S.S. Ticket.effect: The ticket required for sailing on the ferry S.S. Aqua. It has a drawing of a ship on it.

Storage Key.name: Storage Key
Storage Key.effect: The key to Team Galactic's sinister warehouse located at the edge of Veilstone City.

Suite Key.name: Suite Key
Suite Key.effect: A key to one of the suites at the luxury hotel by a lake. For some odd reason, it often disappears.

Sun Flute.name: Sun Flute
Sun Flute.effect: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the sun.

Super Rod.name: Super Rod
Super Rod.effect: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod. Use it by any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

Surge Badge.name: Surge Badge
Surge Badge.effect: Novelty badge from the Kantonian Gym.

Surprise Mulch.name: Surprise Mulch
Surprise Mulch.effect: Mulch to be used in a Berry field. It causes strange, sudden mutations based on the combination of Berry.

Survival Charm.name: Survival Charm
Survival Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect a person from fainting while out in the field.

Tea.name: Tea
Tea.effect: An aromatic tea prepared by an old lady. It will slake even the worst thirst.

Teachy TV.name: Teachy TV
Teachy TV.effect: A television set that is tuned to a program with useful tips for novice TRAINERS.

Tempting Charm.name: Tempting Charm
Tempting Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any other item when you faint in the field.

Tidal Bell.name: Tidal Bell
Tidal Bell.effect: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing.

TM Case.name: TM Case
TM Case.effect: A case that holds TMs and HMs. It is attached to the BAG's compartment for important items.

Town Map.name: Town Map
Town Map.effect: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows your present location.

Tri-Pass.name: Tri-Pass
Tri-Pass.effect: A pass for ferries between ONE, TWO, and THREE ISLAND. It has a drawing of three islands.

Unown Report.name: Unown Report
Unown Report.effect: A report of all the discovered kinds of UNOWN.

Vs. Recorder.name: Vs. Recorder
Vs. Recorder.effect: An amazing device that can record a battle either between friends or at a special battle facility.

Vs. Seeker.name: Vs. Seeker
Vs. Seeker.effect: A device that indicates Trainers who want to battle. Its battery charges while you walk.

Wailmer Pail.name: Wailmer Pail
Wailmer Pail.effect: A nifty watering pail. Use it to promote strong growth in BERRIES planted in soft soil.

Warding Charm.name: Warding Charm
Warding Charm.effect: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect a person from being afflicted with status conditions.

White Mane Hair.name: White Mane Hair
White Mane Hair.effect: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong and very flexible.

Wishing Chip.name: Wishing Chip
Wishing Chip.effect: Toss a number of them into a Pokémon Den for the chance to attract a wild Dynamax Pokémon.

Wishing Star.name: Wishing Star
Wishing Star.effect: A stone found in the Galar region with a mysterious power. It’s said that your dreams come true if you find one.

Wooden Crown.name: Wooden Crown
Wooden Crown.effect: A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to be chipped. Maybe it’s meant to be part of something.

Works Key.name: Works Key
Works Key.effect: A large key for operating the doors of the Valley Windworks in the canyon. It was held by a Team Galactic Grunt.

Xtransceiver.name: Xtransceiver
Xtransceiver.effect: A high-tech transceiver with a camera function. It allows up to four-way calls.

Yellow Petal.name: Yellow Petal
Yellow Petal.effect: Petal received from Sophocles during Mina's trial.

Z-Ring.name: Z-Ring
Z-Ring.effect: A mysterious ring that enables Pokémon to use Z-Power. It requires both the willpower and the physical power of the Trainer wearing it.

Zygarde Cube.name: Zygarde Cube
Zygarde Cube.effect: An item to store Zygarde Cores and Cells. You can also use it to teach Zygarde moves.
